Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2011 01:36PM vamom wrote: holy cow lc, you have been busy! - keep us posted
Posts.Title: Made it through first MRI ginarn lc1975

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2011 07:16PM vamom wrote: yes, you lie face down. there are cutouts for your breasts to hang freely. if you have the kind where they use dye, you will also have an i/v. then they raise you up, slide you in (looks like a big donut) & you lay still. it doesnt hurt at all, its just noisy. they will give you earplugs. after my 1st one, i brought sweatpants the next time, it was freezing in there.  good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Made it through first MRI ginarn lc1975

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2011 04:57PM - edited Nov 8, 2011 04:59PM by vamom good job !  we knew you could do it! and yes, the waiting IS the worst. the best thing i can tell ya is to keep yourself busy, with anything. (i have never been so organized in my life lol). good luck to you lc.
Posts.Title: Made it through first MRI ginarn lc1975

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2011 08:15PM vamom wrote:
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: vamom wrote: hi. im 39years old. i went in late july for yearly mammogram...said fine. sent to specialist for another 'fine' mammogram. i had learned more of my family history & shared that with the doctor...she ordered an MRI. what did i open my big mouth for. i went from 2 'fine' mammos to 6 biopsies, & now surgery next month.  reports came back as not cancer, but very suspicious. i had all my biopsies done in 1 week- it was brutal. this all came up so fast, i havent had time to really process whats going on. it's just been a big blur. i have a long list of questions to take with me when i consult with surgeon. my main concern is what they are going to do. im a small b cup; if what they say is going on, & it has to be cut out, plus surrounding tissue, i am going to look severely deformed. (both breasts) i have a papilloma in each, plus a rare type of fast growing fibroid, plus a benign tumor. i had a benign tumor removed from my breast when i was 29. im high risk. greatgrandfather had breast cancer, maternal aunt had double mastectomy @ 32, spread to her lymph system, died @ 34, maternal aunt, 50, positive BRCA test, elective mastectomy, maternal grandmother died @ 49 from ovarian cancer that had spread. Now, given my history, my family history, & everything that is going on now, how can they NOT reccomend a complete mastectomy? if they dont, i feel like this stuff will keep coming back. they want to take it out, so that tells me it has potential to turn into something. i would prefer a mastectomy. i really cant go through this again. the waiting, the worrying, the wondering. it's pure hell. im trying to stay positive & stay strong for my daughter, but it's hard. also, i am unemployed & have medicaid insurance. after my daughter graduates, im not going to have insurance anymore. i am not going to be able to afford to go in every 6 months to be checked. should i tell the doctor this? Toni- BRCA2+, Strong fam HX, PBMX 12/8/11 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2011 04:50PM vamom wrote: going for BRCA test in the morning. i hope i get the results back before the 19th. i have a feeling this surgeon is not going to do what i want.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 02:46PM vamom wrote: well i had to go redo the BRAC spit thingy. i got a letter from insurance saying they wouldnt pay...i got a call from utah yesterday & the guy tells me they didnt recieve it in time(screw up @ my dr office), but he got everything straight & i just have to go do it again. AND the insurance WILL pay (woo-hoo!)  big thanks to curtis in utah. he was very helpful. i also got a call from the surgeon. he says he still hasnt gotten all 5 of my lab reports, but the ones he did look at he says the 2 largest ones need to come out (1 in each breast). that is not what the specialists told me last week. i had to kinda 'put this mess away' for a week or so to calm myself down so i can process all of this & think with some sense. i was waiting on the results of this brac test to determine what type of surgery i will be having. nobody told me anything except good ol curtis. there are some serious mis/non communication going on & i think its ridiculous.  so. my plan is to get the results of this test, get ALL of my pathology reports, & find myself a new surgeon.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 04:57PM vamom wrote: vsm thank you so much for your kind words & advice. i consult with the surgeon on sept 19th. i have made copies of every single piece of paperwork, labwork, etc... that was done since this whole ordeal began. the more information i look up on my own makes me worry more. i figure it's gonna be what it's gonna be, & i will be fine.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 08:02AM vamom wrote: ok so i went to see the surgeon monday. i was totally disgusted because he had only recieved 1 path report instead of 5 (even after i called to see if he had them) anyway, he really didn't seem to concerned & doesnt want to do anything until i get my BRAC results back. Then i got a call yesterday from the specialist & he tells me that there are no papillomas, no tumors, they are all just regular fibroadenomas, & no surgery is needed. WTF????? i havent ate or slept in 2 months since this whole ordeal began. The MRI was done solely based on my family history. they find all this stuff, scare the hell outta me & now im just supposed to forget about it. I told him im not at all comfortable with 'watching & waiting'. i've been doing that for 10 years now & im tired. one of the things they found was there last year (which i forgot about) has grown from 8mm to 12 mm. there are more than 5, but they chose not to biopsy all of them because "statistically they should be fibroadenomas also" again, WTF?!!!! i cant & wont accept that. i just cant. i told him that this news should make me feel better, but it doesent. dang, i'm barely a b cup, all i have is fibroids huh? Im now waiting for my BRCA results so i can see someone else. i am so lost & confused & angry! first they tell me that these growths are not cancer, but the cells & tissue around them look suspicious...now all a sudden i'm fine? how in the hell am i supposed to accept that? and what if they are just fibroadenomas?...they are painful, not just when aunt flo comes,  all the time. im just supposed to watch them keep growing? then i learned that you can still get cancer with or without the BRCA mutation. all i know is that my breasts are filled with things i wasnt born with, & im not comfortable with 'w&w', & i dont know what to do now.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 08:05AM vamom wrote: i bet if i was a man & my balls were full of lumps they would hurry up & do something!

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2011 04:21PM vamom wrote: thanks Soccermom & VSM. I went to see my regular doctor today to let her know what's going on, and talk about a BRCA  test. She also agreed with my desire for a mastectomy. My aunt's doctor is going to send me some information on what they should specifically be looking for. So far my insurance has paid for everything including all biopsies which were MRI guided (unbelievable, right). im thankful for that. i can't imagine knowing what I know & not be able to do anything about it. I am just trying to make it to the 19th (consult with surgeon). The waiting is driving me nuts. I have cleaned up & out everything in, on, & around a house that can be cleaned! and then some. Anything to keep myself busy. I think I'm ok, it's the 'back of my mind' that needs to be punched!
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2011 03:07PM vamom wrote: curtis from myriad called this morning, said my test was done, & i could call my doctor for the results. i did & they dont have them yet. ugh. waiting for them to call back...... tomorrow is my appointment with the new surgeon. i am so nervous. i feel like a cross between a kid on christmas eve & a kid on the bus bringing home a bad report card!  my hat goes off to all you ladies here. such courage & bravery!
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2011 05:47PM vamom wrote: ok yall, i saw the surgeon today. he didn't have ALL of my reports, or the brac results. we discussed everything we could, & he pretty much agreed with me. he went ahead & scheduled me to see a plastic surgeon (next week). when i got home this evening, my doctor called with brac results. she told me i am positive, with an 84% chance.......soooooo. i had made my mind up long before now, i wasn't afraid. when i heard her say positive, i almost lost it. i had to tell myself that's silly. I am in control, I am on top of things, & I will be fine. a lil busy over the next year, but FINE. i am also mad as shitfire @ those fools i had seen previously. especially the surgeon that chuckled & called PBMX a 'trend'.  i'm tellin you ladies, go with your gut. only you know what's best for you. dont take things lying down & push for what you want. thanks again gals!
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2011 10:04PM vamom wrote: i saw the plastic surgeon today. went pretty well. when we were discussing options, he was showing me on my belly......he had my muffin top in his hands & said i'd end up with a small b. i asked him if he could have peter surgery, would YOU wanna be the same size? he just turned red & smiled. lol. im going with expanders & saline implants. maybe nipple sparing (i hope so). i will know more next week. i also have to quit smoking. he wont touch me til i do. i gave away my last 2 packs. this is my last night. it has to be. simple as that. if i dont, & get this done, he said my nipples could turn black & fall off! so...yeah. quittin time.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2011 10:21PM vamom wrote: thanks carp! -saw my surgeon again. haven't got a definite date yet, but looking @ the first week of december.  i will have NS,SS BMX; TE's & then saline implants. im soooo anxious to get this process started.  im still working on not smoking. man it sucks. hard. in the past few months i was up to a pack & 1/2 /day. now a pack lasts a week. i cant give up the one with coffee, after a meal, after bumping uglies with my ol man, or the one on the commode. lol! but, i will. i will. i will. i know november is going to fly by. i have so much to do. i hafta do all the regular stuff around here, i got some stuff to work on outside in my flower beds, i need to get the extra bedroom ready for my mom, i wanna get my house stocked up good, start christmas shopping, OH! Thanksgiving!- i almost forgot! ooh im really gonna do it up this year since i wont be cooking for a while. mmm. deep fried turkey, candy yams, mac & cheese, collard greens, homemade stuffing, gravy, string beans, corn pudding, homemade rolls, devil eggs, cake! pie! and anything else i can think of. phew. im tired already. AND back & forth a few times im sure to do all the pre-surgery stuff. im glad to be busy; i wont have time to think about it. i made a big mistake & looked @ pics online of BMX & reconstruction. i totally freaked out. im ok now. my surgeon is very comforting.

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2011 09:43AM vamom wrote: I'm so glad i found this site, you ladies are so helpful & kind. AJ, it was my aunt that was BRCA+. I have not been tested yet. I complained a lot at first because it takes me 1 1/2 hours to get there, (in one week i had 4 appointments) but now I am very thankful for the aggressiveness & urgency. I had a very rough summer; a concussion in May, abcessed tooth in June, & poison ivy in July, TWICE!!!! In some weird way I  think all of that downtime was preparing me for this. I am not employed, but I am always busy, & I love outdoors. I get worse than a kid with cabin fever when I can't get out & do what I need to do.
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2011 09:45PM vamom wrote: oh boy. here i go again with the nerves..... now i have a whole new set of questions, worries, & fears. normal, right? right. i dont have time to freak out, too much to do. i see the PS in 1 week, (that was fast) & back to the doc a week after that. after that, i am going to get my MAMA!!!!! she is in arkansas with my sister. she took care of my aunt earlier this year when she had it done. i was just  re-united with my mom, sister, & entire family 1 year ago, after 21 years. it was amazing. i am so thankful & blessed to be able to call on her. anyway. thats a whole nother can o worms.....i dont know why i feel so weird now about this whole thing. i knew i wanted this, but when i heard 84%.....she might as well have smacked me 84 times. i dont know. maybe im just weird. maybe because there is a big difference between want to & have to. oh well. at least now i know what ive been wanting to know. i guess this makes me an official member now. yay? : /
Posts.Title: awaiting surgery vamom vmudrow

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 01:48PM vamom wrote: hey hey hey! day 4 post op. the first night was rough. i pushed that button all night long. 2nd night got bad, had to have a morphine shot. my night nurse 'didn't want to wake me' for my scheduled pain pills so she let me sleep...i woke up crying & screaming...another shot. then, some jackwagon took my blood pressure in my arm - big sign on my door says not to, & i was out of it so i didnt know either, but my arm has not felt right since. it hurts & sometimes my fingers will tingle & go numb. they sent me home with percocet, antibiotics, stool softener, & dilaudid for breakaway pain. i took 1 of those, knocked me out for an hour & when i woke up i was shaking uncontrollably & hallucinating. DO NOT WANT!!!!! that was scary. will NOT take that again.  i was a little upset when they took the bandages off to look. -had to cut me across the top instead of under. no biggie though. i had no idea what to expect, but all in all, i am pretty surprised @ how things went.  not as bad as i thought. i hope everyone else is doing ok & good luck to those who are still waiting - Toni

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2011 08:38PM vamom wrote: hey ladies.  how are you? well i hope. i have been a busy lil bee. organizing & stocking up the house, etc... anything to make the time pass. so anxious to get this process started. i have been waiting for some type of  surgery since september. i made the final decision about a month ago. when your waiting, time seems to drag by, but it really goes fast doesnt it?   Blessings, i hope all went well & you are resting comfortably. Lauren; best of luck to you.  Cookie & REG: have you got a date yet?  hugs & prayers to all of us- Toni
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2011 08:19PM vamom wrote: so what is everyone doing while we're waiting? i'm a homemaker/mom so i don't have a job to go to, but i can't imagine functioning if i did. i don't know about yall, but i am OVERWHELMED. i feel like a  cross between a kid on christmas eve & a kid on the bus with a bad report card. my poor daughter has missed out on a lot this year because of me. this year i have had a bad concussion, emergency tooth extraction, head-toe poison ivy- TWICE!! hospital the 2nd time. then this mess started in late july. i went from 2 'fine' mammograms to MRI (based on fam history) to 5 core needle biopsies,  so far everything is benign. i have been waiting for some type of surgery since september. i couldn't get a clear dx from the specialist or the bs as to what these things are or what to do with them. i i fired those fools, went & got a BRCA test on my own ( no one even suggested it to me which i thought was funny because this whole thing started because of my strong fam hist.) i made an appt at a well known cancer center & my new surgeon approved me for PBMX BEFORE i even got my BRCA results back!  even though i already knew what i wanted to do, when my results came back +, i freaked out a lil more. sooo since like oh late july i have been on all downhill rollercoaster. i seriously need to calm down. december 8th is coming fast.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011
